title: Live criteria sync with file watching (no flash)
description: Add real-time criteria progress updates during Ralph iterations. Currently, the iteration header shows stale criteria counts because it reads JSON once before Claude starts working. Implement file watching to detect when Claude updates story JSON files and refresh the display in-place. Use fswatch (macOS) or inotifywait (Linux). CRITICAL: No flashing or full re-renders. Update ONLY the specific characters that changed using ANSI cursor positioning.

acceptanceCriteria.text: Watcher writes changed filename to a temp FIFO/pipe
_ralph_poll_updates() reads pipe non-blocking during Claude execution
On current story JSON change, re-read criteria with _ralph_get_story_criteria_progress
NO FLASHING: update only changed characters, never clear/redraw entire box
Track line positions: store row number of criteria line when first drawn
Use ANSI \e[{row};{col}H to position cursor at exact criteria location
Debounce: max 1 update per 500ms to prevent rapid flicker
Also update story progress bar (40/46) when index.json changes
_ralph_stop_watcher() kills background process, called in EXIT trap
Store watcher PID in RALPH_WATCHER_PID for cleanup
If no fswatch available, log once and continue with stale behavior
Add --no-live flag to disable file watching
Fix ralph-live flashing: apply same no-flash technique
